edu.nyu.cs.javagit.utilities
Class CheckUtilities

java.lang.Object
  edu.nyu.cs.javagit.utilities.CheckUtilities

public class CheckUtilities
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides utilities methods that perform various checks for validity.

checkFileValidity

public static void checkFileValidity(java.lang.String filename)
                              throws java.io.IOException
Checks that the specified filename exists. This assumes that the above check for string validity has already been run and the path/filename is neither null or of size 0.

Parameters:
filename - File or directory path
Throws:
java.io.IOException

                              throws java.io.IOException
Checks that the specified file exists.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

checkIntArgumentGreaterThan

public static void checkIntArgumentGreaterThan(int toCheck,
                                               int lowerBound,
                                               java.lang.String variableName)
Checks that the int to check is greater than lowerBound. If the int to check is not greater than lowerBound, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
toCheck - The int to check.
lowerBound - The lower bound to check against.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkNullArgument

public static void checkNullArgument(java.lang.Object obj,
                                     java.lang.String variableName)
Performs a null check on the specified object. If the object is null, a NullPointerException is thrown.

Parameters:
obj - The object to check.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkNullListArgument

public static void checkNullListArgument(java.util.List<?> list,
                                         java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a List<?> argument to make sure it is not null, has length > 0, and none of its elements are null. If the List<?> or any contained instance is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the List<?> or any contained instance has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
list - The list to check.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkListsEqual

public static boolean checkListsEqual(java.util.List<?> l1,
                                      java.util.List<?> l2)
Checks that two lists are equal, specifically: they are both null or the both contain the same elements.

Parameters:
l1 - The first list to check.
l2 - The second list to check.
Returns:
True if one of the following conditions hold:
  1. Both lists are null
  2. a) Neither list is null; b) for each element in list 1 an equivalent element exists in list 2; and c) for each element in list 2, an equivalent element exists in list 1

checkObjectsEqual

public static boolean checkObjectsEqual(java.lang.Object o1,
                                        java.lang.Object o2)
Checks to see if two objects are equal. The Object.equal() method is used to check for equality.

Parameters:
o1 - The first object to check.
o2 - The second object to check.
Returns:
True if the two objects are equal. False if the objects are not equal.

checkStringArgument

public static void checkStringArgument(java.lang.String str,
                                       java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a String argument to make sure it is not null and contains one or more characters. If the String is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the String has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
str - The string to check.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkStringListArgument

public static void checkStringListArgument(java.util.List<java.lang.String> str,
                                           java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a List<String> argument to make sure it is not null, none of its elements are null, and all its elements contain one or more characters. If the List<String> or a contained String is null, a NullPointerException is thrown. If the List<String> or a contained String has length zero, an IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
str - The List<String> to check.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkUnorderedListsEqual

public static boolean checkUnorderedListsEqual(java.util.List<?> l1,
                                               java.util.List<?> l2)
Checks if two unordered lists are equal.

Parameters:
l1 - The first list to test.
l2 - The second list to test.
Returns:
True if:
  • both lists are null or
  • both lists are the same length, there exists an equivalent object in l2 for all objects in l1, and there exists an equivalent object in l1 for all objects in l2
False otherwise.

checkIntIndexInListRange

public static void checkIntIndexInListRange(java.util.List<?> list,
                                            int index)
Check if the index provided to list is within the range i.e. positive and less than the size of the . If the index is less than 0 or greater than equal to the size of the list then IndexOutOfBoundsException is thrown.

Parameters:
list - for which the index is being verified.
index - Index in the list.

checkIntInRange

public static void checkIntInRange(int index,
                                   int start,
                                   int end)
A general range check utility for checking whether a given <integer> value is between a given start and end indexes. This is a helper method for other methods such as checkIntIndexInListRange or can also be used independently by external objects.

Parameters:
index - Given index that is being checked for validity between start and end.
start - index should be greater than or equal to start.
end - index should be less than end.

validateListRefType

public static void validateListRefType(java.util.List<Ref> list,
                                       Ref.RefType type,
                                       java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a List argument to make sure that all the Ref in the list are of same refType type. If there is a mismatch IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
list - The List to check.
type - The refType check against.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

validateArgumentRefType

public static void validateArgumentRefType(Ref name,
                                           Ref.RefType type,
                                           java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a Ref argument to make sure that it is of given refType type. If not IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
name - The argument to check.
type - The refType to check against.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.

checkDirectoryArgument

public static void checkDirectoryArgument(java.io.File fileName,
                                          java.lang.String variableName)
Checks a File argument to make sure that it is a directory. If not IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

Parameters:
fileName - The File to be checked.
variableName - The name of the variable being checked; for use in exception messages.
